Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: LaFleur et al v. Dollar Tree Stores, Inc.
HEGAB v. FAMILY DOLLAR STORES, INC.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/545812/family-dollar-forks-over-1-15m-to-settle-manager-ot-suit

Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/592129/family-dollar-pays-2-3m-to-settle-manager-ot-class-action

Private Litigation Case Title: Twila Walters V Family Dollar Stores of Missouri I
Info Source: https://www.edgarlawfirm.com/News-Investigations/MO-Lawyers-Familydollar.pdf

Private Litigation Case Title: Youngblood et al v. Family Dollar Stores, Inc. et al; Rancharan v. Family Dollar Stores, Inc.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/377252/family-dollar-strikes-14m-settlement-in-ot-class-action

Private Litigation Case Title: Smith et al v. Dollar Tree Distribution Inc.
Morgan, et al v. Family Dollar Stores
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/126482/family-dollar-s-cert-bid-fails-in-35-5m-flsa-case
Notes: An opt-in class of 1,424 store managers, in a collective action certified by the district court, sued Family Dollar Stores, Inc. for unpaid overtime wages under the Fair Labor Standards Act.?The jury found that the store managers were not exempt executives and that Family Dollar had willfully denied them overtime pay. The jury awarded $19,092,003.39 in overtime wages. The court entered a final judgment of $35,576,059.48 against Family Dollar consisting of $17,788,029.74 in overtime wages and an equal amount in liquidated damages. Family Dollar unsuccessfully appealed the ruling all the way to the U.S. Supreme Court.
